title: LoyceV
author: LoyceV
content: User lazygurumaster posted a no doubt fake mixer as "the best". Post archived. The domain advertised as "the best mixer" was created only a week ago:Code:Domain Name: foxmixer.org                                                                                                             Registry Domain ID: da3a19ae782e457eb3ed965d7a8e8c16-LROR                                                                             Registrar WHOIS Server: whois.namecheap.com                                                                                           Registrar URL: http://www.namecheap.com                                                                                               Updated Date: 2022-05-23T08:34:31Z                                                                                                    Creation Date: 2022-05-23T08:34:17ZA topic about the .com site was created 5 years ago, but it closed. I'll Flag this Newbie as a warning.Flag: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=trust;flag=2977Well, that's useless: the Newbie Flag doesn't show up in Bitcoin Discussion.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: LoyceV on June 08, 2022, 10:11:35 AMUser lazygurumaster posted a no doubt fake mixer as "the best". Post archived. The domain advertised as "the best mixer" was created only a week ago:I checked full history of his posts and I doubt he was intentionally trying to post link for some suspicious scam.Most likely he just copy-pasted article about mixers he found on internet and made few changes.I made quick plagiarism check for one part of his post and it showed around 50% of his content was plagiarized.He should be banned for doing this, here is one of the source articles:https://dev.to/igor4btc/best-bitcoin-mixers-in-2021-55d0Quote from: LoyceV on June 08, 2022, 10:11:35 AMWell, that's useless: the Newbie Flag doesn't show up in Bitcoin Discussion.It's not completely useless because anyone can check his profile for more information, but I agree that Bitcoin Discussion (and few more boards) should have visible trust feedback for accounts.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: dkbit98 on June 08, 2022, 07:18:19 PMQuote from: LoyceV on June 08, 2022, 10:11:35 AMWell, that's useless: the Newbie Flag doesn't show up in Bitcoin Discussion.It's not completely useless because anyone can check his profile for more information, but I agree that Bitcoin Discussion (and few more boards) should have visible trust feedback for accounts.I had no idea flags (and whatever else) weren't visible in Bitcoin Discussion, and that seems pretty ridiculous to me.  Trust scores and all the data that's usually included in your avatar/profile space should be visible in every section IMO.  Regardless of whether there's trading going on in BD or any other section, it's nice to be able to see a member's stats--and I'm also pretty sure it wouldn't be a hard thing to get that done.Anyhow, if this jackoff is a serial plagiarist, there's no need to worry about any flags, is there?  I'm assuming there's an imminent ban coming and that said plagiarism has been reported (am I right, dkbit98?).

comments.author: mole0815
comments.body: Quote from: The Pharmacist on June 08, 2022, 08:07:17 PMAnyhow, if this jackoff is a serial plagiarist, there's no need to worry about any flags, is there?  I'm assuming there's an imminent ban coming and that said plagiarism has been reported (am I right, dkbit98?).User is nuked.Flag, scammer and plagiarism in three posts is just too much to expect a long future here.
